author: sky.cactus
content: On a related note: I feel like binding development to named forks is going to result in a *lot* of pain and I recommend not doing that.

author: sky.cactus
content: It is incredibly common in the EL world for features to be coded in clients long prior to them finalizing into a fork, and some changesets live in clients for many forks before finally getting activated in a hardfork.

author: arnetheduck
content: in many ways, I think it would be clearer / more clean to _not_ merge any eip4844 work at all and keep it in a rebased feature branch until capella is shipped - then we have a go/no-go for 4844 in the next HF and _that's_ when everything is merged
